availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry B. Wallen (Clinton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Clinton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of George and Mary Wallen. Attended school in Wayne County, Kentucky, in 1850. Stone Mason in Clinton County in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Calvary Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 19, 1861 to December 31, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Division 1, p. 64B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clinton County, p.257.
“Wallen, Henry,” Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0012.
"Henry B. Wallen (1837-1908)," Find A Grave, Memorial 32958869, accessed January 9, 2024, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/32958869.
